text:
For me, I think the hardware and software are already there for when the sample is perfectly prepared. I'm probably interested in a more unified wiki of clearing techniques, rather than better chemistry. I think the techniques are out there, but a place to find example protocols, expected result images, etc. is lacking.

My failures always occur when the sample is not quite right and this may be a downfall of light-sheet for me. I am imaging cleared mouse eyeballs whole and following a protocol from a paper, but I am still unable to get the cells I'm interested in resolved to the correct degree. I've tried lots of troubleshooting (despite none in the paper) and it hasn't helped. This would turn people away from light-sheet.
